definitions.definition: An image or representation of anything formed in the mind.
An opinion or notion formed without much reflection.

definitions.example: I had a fancy to learn to play the flute.
He took a fancy to her.

definitions.definition: The object of inclination or liking.
Any sport or hobby pursued by a group.
definitions.example: Trainspotting is the fancy of a special lot.

definitions.definition: The enthusiasts of such a pursuit.
definitions.example: He fell out of favor with the boxing fancy after the incident.

definitions.definition: A diamond with a distinctive colour.
That which pleases or entertains the taste or caprice without much use or value.
A sort of love song or light impromptu ballad.
In the game of jacks, a style of play involving additional actions (contrasted with plainsies).
To appreciate without jealousy or greed.
definitions.example: I fancy your new car, but I like my old one just fine.
Do you fancy going to town this weekend?
I fancy that girl over there.

definitions.definition: To form a conception of; to portray in the mind.
To have a fancy for; to like; to be pleased with, particularly on account of external appearance or manners.
